result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Michel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian L. Michel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian L. Michel was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before Jan 9, 2015.  EMP approved, per jail rules.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian L. Michel in court with attorney Paul Douglas Polacek.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
45 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Jail to commence on or before Jan 9, 2014 at 6 p.m.  EMP approved, per jail rules.  
Paperwork handed in court.
